N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 105.1 - Cider tastings and sales

State Regulations
(a) Any
person licensed as a cider producer or wholesaler may conduct cider tastings of

New York State labeled cider in premises licensed to sell alcoholic beverages
pursuant to Part 63 of this Title for off-premises consumption. (b) Such cider tastings may also be conducted
in premises licensed pursuant to Part 64 of this Title for on-premises
consumption. (c) Cider producers or
wholesalers may apply for a permit to sell cider by the bottle during such
tastings in premises licensed for on-premises consumption. (d) Such cider producers or wholesalers may
charge a fee of not more than 25 cents for each sample tasted. (e) Such cider tastings shall be conducted by
an official agent, representative or solicitor of one or more of the cider
producers or wholesalers and that person shall be present at all times during
the cider tastings. (f) Any
liability resulting from a cause of action from a cider tasting authorized
pursuant to this subdivision and in accordance with sections
11-100
and
11-101
of the General Obligations Law
shall accrue to the cider producer or wholesaler. (g) Notwithstanding any provision of this

Chapter to the contrary: a licensed cider producer or wholesaler may apply for
a permit to sell New York State labeled cider at the State Fair, not-for-profit
farmers markets and recognized county fairs. As a condition precedent to the
issuance of such permit, a representative, agent or solicitor for the cider
producer or wholesaler must be present at the time of sale or
tasting. (h) One or more cider
producers or wholesaler licensees may singly or jointly apply for a license to
sell cider for consumption off the premises for the duration of the applicant's
license. (i) The fee for such
off-premises cider license shall be $500 if the retail premises are in cities
which have a population of one million or more, $250 in cities having a
population of less than one million, but more than 100,000 and $125
elsewhere. (j) Not more than five
such licenses may be issued to any licensed cider producer or
wholesaler. (k) No retail licensee
of cider authorized by this statute shall keep or permit to be kept any
unsealed bottle or other container of cider except for the purpose of tasting
or sampling by any person authorized to conduct such tasting or
sampling. (l) Sales are prohibited
to those persons set forth in Part 65 of this Title. Notes
